gurmukhi: kwnH ky pws geI jb hI qb hI sB gopn lIn su sM|w ]cIr pry igr kY qn BUKn tUt geI iqn hwQn bM|w ]
transliteration: Kaahn Ke Paas Gadjab Hitab Hisabh Gopan Leen Su Sanad|| Cheer Dare Gir Kai Tan Bhookhan Toot Gadtin Haatahan Banad||
translation: When the gopis reached near Krishna, their consciousness returned and they saw that their ornaments and garments had fallen down and in their impatience, the bangles of their hands had broken;

gurmukhi: kwnH ko rUp inhwr sBY gupIAw kib sXwm BeI iek rM|w ]hoie geI qn mY sB hI iek rMg mno sB Cof kY sM|w ]451]
transliteration: Kaahn Ko Roop Nihaar Sabhai Goupeeaa Goupeeaa Kabi Syaam Bhaiik Ranad|| Hoe Gadtan Mai Sabh Hiik Ran Mano Sabh Chhodh Kai Sanad||451||
translation: Seeing the countenance of Krishna, became one with him and intoxicated with this unison they all cast away their shyness of body and mind.451.

gurmukhi: gopn BUl geI giH kI suD kwnH hI ky rs BIqr rwcI ]Bauh BrI mDrI brnI sBhI su FrI jnu mYn kY swcI ]
transliteration: Gopan Bhool Gadgrih Kisudh Kaahn Hike Ras Bheetar Raachee|| Bhauh Bharimadharisabh-hisu Dharijan(u) Main Kai Saachee||
translation: Imbued with the love of Krishna, the gopis forgot the consciousness about their houses; their eyebrows and eyelashes were showering wine and it appeared that the god of love had himself created them;

gurmukhi: Cor dey rs Aaurn s√çwd Bly Bgvwn hI so sB mwcI ]soBq qw qn mY hir ky mno kMcn mY cunIAw cun KwcI ]452]
transliteration: Chhodh Dae Ras Auran Svaad Bhale Bhagvaan Hiso Sabh Maachee|| Sobhat Taa Tan Mai Har(i) Ke Mano Kanchanndmai Chouneeaa Choun Khaachee||452||
translation: They forgot all other pleasures except their absorption in the love of Krishna and looked splendid like the select idols of gold heaped together.452.

gurmukhi: kwnH ko rUp inhwr rhI biRj mY ju huqI gupIAw Aiq hwCI ]rwjq jwih miRgIpq nYn ibrwjq suMdr hY sm mwCI ]
transliteration: Kaahn Ko Roop Nihaar Rahibrij Mai Ju Houtigoupeeaa At(i) Haachhee|| Raajat Jaah(i) Mrigeepat Nain Biraajat Soundar Hai Sam Maachhee||
translation: The most beautiful gopis of Braja are seeing the beauty of Krishna; their eyes are beautiful like doe and their creation and features are like fish;

gurmukhi: soBq hY biRjmMfl mY jn Kylby kwj ntI ieh kwCI ]dyKn hwr ikDo Bgvwn dKwvq Bwv hmY ihX AwCI ]453]
transliteration: Sobhat Hai Brijmandal Mai Jan Khelbe Kaaj Natieh Kaadhhee|| Dekhan Haar Kidho Bhagvaan Dakhaavat Bhaav Hamai Hiya Aachhee||453||
translation: They are playful like the wandering female dancers of Braja and on the pretext of seeing Krishna, they are exhibiting charming gestures.453.

gurmukhi: sohq hY sB goipn ky kib sXwm khY diRg AMjn AwNjy ]kaulx kI jnu su`iD pRBw sr suMdr swx ky aUpir mwNjy ]
transliteration: Sohat Hai Sabh Gopin Ke Kabi Syam Kahai Drig Anjan Aanje|| Kaulan Kijan(u) Suddh(i) Prabhaa Sar Soundar Saan Ke Oopar(i) Maanje||
translation: The poet Shyam says that amidst all the gopis, Krishna is looking impressive, with antimony in his eyes; his beauty is being seen like the pure beauty of the lotus-flowers;

gurmukhi: bYT GrI iekmY cqucwnn mYn ky qwq bny ks swjy ]mohiq hY mn jogn ky Pun joign ky gn bIck lwjy ]454]
transliteration: Baith Ghariikmai Chatouchaanan Mai Ke Taat Bade Kas Saaje Mohat(i) Hai Man Jogad Ke Phoun Jogin Ke Gad Beechak Laaje||454||
translation: It seems that Brahma has created him as the brother of the god of love and he is so mush beautiful that he is even alluring the minds of Yogis; Krishna of unique beauty besieged by the gopis, appears like a gana besieged by the Yoginis.454.

gurmukhi: TwiF hY kwnH soaU mih gopn jwih ko AMq munI nih bUJy ]koit krY aupmw bhu brKn nYnn so qau nYk n sUJy ]
transliteration: Thaadh(i) Hai Kaahn Sooo Maih Gopan Jaah(i) Ko Ant Mounndnah(i) Boodhee|| Kottee Darai Oupmaa Bahu Barkhan Nainan So Tau Naik Na Soojhe||
translation: The same Krishna is standing amidst gopis, whose end could not be comprehended by the sages, millions praise him for many years, still He cannot be comprehended a little with the eyes;

gurmukhi: qwhI ky AMiq lKYby kwrn sUr Gny rn BIqr JUJy ]so biRj BUm ibKY Bgvwn qRIAw gn mY rs bYn ArUJy ]455]
transliteration: Taahike Ant(i) Lakhaibe Kaaran Soor Ghane Ran Bheetar Jhoojhe|| So Bhoom Bikhai Bhagvaan Treeaa Gad Mai Ras Baindaroojhe||455||
translation: In order to know His limits, many warriors have fought bravely in the battlefield; and today the same Krishna is absorbed in amorous dialogue with the gopis in Braja.455.
